title: Yandex Plugin
content:
Hi, I'm a long time firefox user and it has been long since I installed my firefox. But I remember first thing I do while preparing to use firefox, I removed -or I thought I did- YANDEX and anything related to it. After years I opened my ccleaner and when I clicked Tools - Browser plugins I saw there is still yandex extention which version is 1.2 and enabled. When I disable it through cclenaer, It closes firefox and disables it. After closing both ccleaner and firefox, I controlled them again it is still enabled... Also I tried about:config I saw browser.topsites.experiment.yandex-2021-1 true I NEVER ADMIT ANY EXPERIMENT I set those valuse false but when I restrat firefox I saw app.normandy.startupRolloutPrefs.browser.topsites.experiment.yandex-2021-1 true again.

I REALLY start to doubt firefox privacy what is going on? Why can't I get rid of YANDEX Is firefox belong to YANDEX? What information yandex could have? already have?
creator: woody114723

title: Spellcheck not available
content:
Hello,

despite I have activated spell check under settings and installed two dictionaries the "language" option with the right mouse button does not exist, e.g. in this very window. What do I do wrong?

My system: WIN10 64bit, Firefox 90.0.2 (32bit)
creator: posts

title: Browser Location Blocker Failing
content:
When on a particular site just now (stubhub.com), when attempting to manually enter a location to refine a search, I accidentally selected "current location" from a dropdown menu on the site. I was prompted, as expected, by firefox: "stubhub wants to access your location", "allow" or "block". After selecting "block", the location still updated on the site to my current location. I repeated the above steps over again to ensure I wasn't mistaken.


I am not personally concerned about this particular instance, but thought the team may want to hear about something like this. New to Mozilla support boards, so let me know if I am even posting in the right spot for this, or if things like a screen recording of the issue occurring would be helpful.
creator: NiceGuyEric

title: Seems like there is a memoryleak in firefox or a component

title: Force New Tabs to open in a Specific WIndow
content:
Greetings

Currently running 90.0.2 (64-bit) on Xubuntu.

I currently run two Firefox Windows. One is a single tab which contains a dashboard for databases that we are monitoring. The second (on a different monitor) is my "everything else window". When I click a link that is not in a browser (for instance in an email), I want to force the new tab to open in a specific window (the everything else one) or even better, to not open in a specific window (the other one).

Any suggestions would be gratefully received. Trying not to use a different browser to solve this.

TIA

Nigel.
creator: dna5

title: Remove sneakily installed saving option of download
content:
Hi guys,

I don't know when and how exactly this thing was added to my firefox behind my back, I don't like it, I don't like Baidu Pan either but I have to use it.

I checked the extensions and add-ons, nothing suspicious was found.

Can you please help me remove it?

title: Tomo capturas de pantalla completa en el menú de F12 y no se guardan
content:
Hace tiempo no usaba esta opción de tomar captura de pantalla completa con el botón de cámara del menú de desarrollador que se despliega presionando F12.

Lo presiono, suena el obturador, pero no veo que se guarden las imágenes, normalmente se guardaban en Descargas.
creator: nicknico2

title: Video Services Return Outdated Browser Errors Even After Upgrading to Firefox 90
content:
I've been watching various video streamers (Netflix, Hulu, etc.) without any issues and then without warning first Peacock's site returned an "incompatible device" error, then Netflix, Hulu, and another service all returned outdated browser errors (see attached Hulu error screen). My basic system info (from safe mode): 

   Application Basics    ------------------        Name: Firefox    Version: 90.0.2    Build ID: 20210721174149    Distribution ID:    Update Channel: release    User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:90.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/90.0    OS: Windows_NT 10.0 19042    Launcher Process: Enabled    Multiprocess Windows: 1/1    Fission Windows: 0/1 Disabled by safe mode    Remote Processes: 6    Enterprise Policies: Inactive    Google Location Service Key: Found    Google Safebrowsing Key: Found    Mozilla Location Service Key: Found    Safe Mode: true


A recent kb described this exact problem but assured that upgrading past version 88 would resolve it

[to play videos from streaming services...]

so I'm out of ideas.
creator: haleba
